dmca.title: [ADMINS] Cease and Desist Request - Multi Issues - Aflac, Second Request; Ref: 2.2.12
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Carter 
Sent: Thursday, September 21, 2006 2:28 PM
To: Legal
Subject: FW: [ADMINS] Cease and Desist Request - Multi Issues - Aflac,
Second Request; Ref: 2.2.126 [ID3:_bZeHZ]`gY_19:ID3]



-----Original Message-----
From: aflacbrandprotection@aflac.com
Sent: Thursday, September 21, 2006 2:19 PM
To: Admins
Cc: 983e8c6cdca94e2bad128e824efd4100.protect@whoisguard.com
Subject: [ADMINS] Cease and Desist Request - Multi Issues - Aflac,
Second Request; Ref: 2.2.126 [ID3:_bZeHZ]`gY_19:ID3]

9/21/2006

 

Dear Technical Support:

 

This is a follow-up to Aflac?s cease and desist request emailed to you
on (insert date); Aflac has not received a response from you.  

 

This email is to notify you that Aflac is the owner of the Aflac mark.
We recently became aware of your use of our trademarked word Aflac in
multiple page elements at http://4040.ha326.info/ to attract internet
traffic to your website. Your use of this trademark to attract internet
traffic is an obvious attempt to capitalize upon the goodwill associated
with the Aflac name.  

 

Accordingly, Aflac demands that you immediately cease and desist from
any further use of the Aflac mark on your website. Additionally, Aflac
must receive a reply to this email within five (5) days of the date of
this email as written confirmation that you will make no use of the
Aflac marks in the future.  

 

We will be monitoring your website and we await your written
confirmation via email to aflacbrandprotection@aflac.com. Provided you
immediately comply with our reasonable demands, legal action may be
avoided.  

 

Nothing in this email shall be deemed a waiver of any rights or remedies
of Aflac, all of which are expressly reserved.

 

Sincerely,

Brand Protection Coordinator

 

Ref: 2.2.126
